00020 /// @file  apt-matrix-diff.cpp
00021 /// @brief Simple program to check that two matrices are the same.
00022 
00023 //
00024 #include "util/AptVersionInfo.h"
00025 #include "util/Convert.h"
00026 #include "util/Err.h"
00027 #include "util/FsPath.h"
00028 #include "util/MatrixCheck.h"
00029 #include "util/MixedFileCheck.h"
00030 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00031 #include "util/RowFile.h"
00032 #include "util/TableFile.h"
00033 #include "util/TextFileCheck.h"
00034 #include "util/Verbose.h"

00036 #include <cstring>
00037 #include <map>

00041 using namespace std;

00043 
00044 void define_aptmatrixdiff_options(PgOptions* opts)
00045 {
00046   opts->setUsage("apt-matrix-diff - check to see if two matrices contain the same values.\n\n"
00047                  "This can be annoying to do with a regular diff as differences in \n"
00048                  "precision and outputting functions can lead to representational \n"
00049                  "differences for two numbers that are the same (i.e. 1.0 == 1).\n\n"
00050                  "usage:\n"
00051                  "   apt-matrix-diff -col-skip 1 -line-skip 1 file1.tab file2.tab");
00052                  
00053   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00054                      "This message.",
00055                      "false");
00056   opts->defineOption("m", "match-rows", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00057                      "Try to match rows based on row names (useful for matrices in different orders).",
00058                      "false");
00059   opts->defineOption("a", "allowed-mismatch", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00060                      "Maximum number of non-matching numeric values accepted.",
00061                      "0");
00062   opts->defineOption("p", "print-mismatch", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00063                      "Print out entries that don't match.",
00064                      "false");
00065   opts->defineOption("", "print-mismatch-max", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00066                      "Maximum number of entries to that don't match to report.",
00067                      "-1");
00068   opts->defineOption("t", "text", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00069                      "Compare files as straight text, without conversion to numeric "
00070                      "data.  This behaves in a fashion very similar to diff, except that "
00071                      "line-skip number of header lines and all line ending differences "
00072                      "are ignored.",
00073                      "false");
00074   opts->defineOption("", "mixed", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00075                      "Compare files as a mixture of numeric and non-numeric data. If a "
00076                      "field can be converted to a floating point number, compare numerically; "
00077                      "if not, compare as text.",
00078                      "false");
00079   opts->defineOption("l", "line-skip", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00080                      "Number of lines (header?) to skip.",
00081                      "0");
00082   opts->defineOption("c", "col-skip", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00083                      "Number of columns (row names?) to skip.",
00084                      "0");
00085   opts->defineOption("e", "epsilon", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00086                      "Epsilon tolerance to differences.",
00087                      ".001");
00088   opts->defineOption("f", "fraction", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00089                      "Fractional tolerance to differences.",
00090                      "0.0");
00091   opts->defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00092                      "Display version information.",
00093                      "false");
00094 }
00095 
00096 /**
00097  * Check each entry in two matrices to see if they are the same.  If
00098  * doing 'match-rows' we will attempt to find the matching row by the
00099  * row name.
00100  *
00101  * @param opts - Options supplied to program.
00102  * @return number of entries where difference is greater than epsilon
00103  */
00104 int matrixDiff(PgOptions *opts) {
00105   int colSkip = opts->getInt("col-skip");
00106   int rowSkip = opts->getInt("line-skip");
00107   double epsilon = opts->getDouble("epsilon");
00108   double fraction = opts->getDouble("fraction");
00109   int mmAllowed = opts->getInt("allowed-mismatch");
00110   bool verbose = opts->getBool("print-mismatch");
00111   int mmMaxShow = opts->getInt("print-mismatch-max");
00112   const bool text = opts->getBool("text");
00113   const bool mixed = opts->getBool("mixed");
00114   bool matchRows = opts->getBool("match-rows");
00115   if(opts->getArgCount() != 2) {
00116     Err::errAbort("Must have exactly two file name arguments.");
00117   }
00118   if(text && mixed) {
00119     Err::errAbort("Options 'text' and 'mixed' cannot both be true.");
00120   }
00121   Verbose::setLevel(2);
00122   if (text) {
00123     TextFileCheck textCheck (opts->getArg(0), opts->getArg(1), rowSkip);
00124     string errorMsg;
00125     const bool textOk = textCheck.check (errorMsg);
00126     if (! textOk && verbose) {
00127       Verbose::out (1, errorMsg);
00128     }
00129     // A return of 0 is good, 1 is bad.
00130     return ! textOk;
00131   }
00132   else if (mixed) {
00133     MixedFileCheck mixedCheck (opts->getArg(0), opts->getArg(1), epsilon, rowSkip, mmAllowed, fraction);
00134     if( mmMaxShow >= 0 ) {
00135       mixedCheck.setMaxError(mmMaxShow);
00136     }
00137     string errorMsg;
00138     const bool mixedOk = mixedCheck.check (errorMsg);
00139         // errorMsg, if any, is already (unconditionally) reported by check method
00140         return ! mixedOk;
00141   }
00142   else {
00143     MatrixCheck matrixCheck (opts->getArg(0), opts->getArg(1), epsilon, rowSkip, colSkip, matchRows, mmAllowed, fraction);
00144         matrixCheck.setPrintMismatch(verbose);
00145     if( mmMaxShow >= 0 ) {
00146       matrixCheck.setPrintMismatchMax(mmMaxShow);
00147     }
00148     string errorMsg;
00149     const bool matrixOk = matrixCheck.check (errorMsg);
00150     if (! matrixOk && verbose) {
00151       Verbose::out (1, errorMsg);
00152     }
00153     return ! matrixOk;
00154   }
00155 }
00156 
00157 /** Everybody's favorite function. */
00158 int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) {
00159   try {
00160   const string version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00161 
00162   int same = 0;
00163 
00164   PgOptions *opts = NULL;
00165   opts = new PgOptions();
00166   define_aptmatrixdiff_options(opts);
00167   opts->parseArgv(argv);
00168 
00169   // Do we need help?
00170   if(opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1) {
00171     opts->usage();
00172     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00173   }
00174   else if(opts->getBool("version")) {
00175     cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00176   }
00177   else {
00178     same = matrixDiff(opts);
00179   }
00180   delete opts;
00181   return same;
00182   } 
00183   catch(...) {
00184       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00185       return 1;
00186   }
00187 }
